thresholds.name: Ashida body-width crossover ratio
thresholds.description: Body W:H ratio where Helmholtz stripe effect transitions from slimming to widening
thresholds.source: Interpolated from Thompson cylinder fade + Ashida midpoint (only 2 body sizes tested)

thresholds.name: Transition zone bounds
thresholds.description: Zone where stripe effect direction is unreliable; extremely high individual variability

thresholds.name: Full reversal onset
thresholds.description: Above this, horizontal stripes clearly widen and vertical stripes slim
thresholds.evidence: Imai 1982: overweight figure at W:H ~0.70-0.80 showed 15.37% reversal

thresholds.name: Transition steepness parameter
thresholds.description: Sigmoid steepness for body-width-dependent stripe scoring. Higher = sharper; lower = more gradual. Set to match observed high variability.

thresholds.name: Oppel-Kundt peak filler count
thresholds.description: Oppel-Kundt expansion peaks at this range then declines. Wackermann refined to 15-16 via functional fit.

thresholds.name: Duty cycle effect range
thresholds.description: Duty cycle 0.1 (thick lines) -> 4.1% effect; duty cycle 0.9 (narrow lines) -> 10.1%

thresholds.name: Comparison baseline reduction factor
thresholds.description: When comparing H-stripes to plain (not to V-stripes), effect reduced to 30%

thresholds.name: 3D vs 2D amplification multiplier
thresholds.description: 3D viewing amplifies stripe effect by 1.84x (10.7%/5.8%)

thresholds.name: L* slimming onset threshold
thresholds.description: Below this, slimming effect is measurable

thresholds.name: L* maximum slimming zone
thresholds.description: Below this (jet black), maximum slimming achieved. Going darker adds almost nothing.

thresholds.name: L* saturation asymptote
thresholds.description: Below L*~25, each additional unit of darkness adds <0.01% width change (diminishing returns)
thresholds.source: Koutsoumpis 2021: 37x luminance difference produced SMALLER effect than 2x

thresholds.name: Sigmoid midpoint
thresholds.description: L* value where luminance effect passes through zero

thresholds.name: Sigmoid steepness
thresholds.description: Controls transition sharpness of luminance scoring function

thresholds.name: Background multiplier gamma
thresholds.description: Non-linear background amplification exponent

thresholds.name: Background multiplier range
thresholds.description: White bg ~0.15 (near-zero effect); black bg ~3.15 (strong effect)

thresholds.name: Background amplification ratio (dark/light)
thresholds.description: Dark background amplifies luminance slimming 7x vs light background
thresholds.source: Koutsoumpis Exp 3: PSE 0.21 deg vs 0.03 deg

thresholds.name: Reference body width ratio
thresholds.description: W:H ratio used as reference for proportionality correction. Wider bodies get proportionally less benefit.

thresholds.name: Fabric sheen modifiers
thresholds.description: Multiplier on luminance slimming effect based on fabric surface properties

thresholds.name: Skin-garment contrast thresholds
thresholds.description: deltaL>60: boundary sharpened (+0.5-1.5% width). deltaL<30: boundary blends.

thresholds.name: Müller-Lyer optimal fin angle
thresholds.description: Maximum elongation (15-18% wings-out) occurs at ~30 degree fin angle

thresholds.name: Müller-Lyer null angle
thresholds.description: At 90 degrees, effect drops to zero. Any design element at perpendicular is neutral.

thresholds.name: V-neckline gap reversal threshold
thresholds.description: If V-neckline doesn't contact body (stands away by 8-18mm), assimilation-to-contrast shift can REVERSE ML illusion

thresholds.name: Deep V skin exposure widening threshold
thresholds.description: Exposed skin width >30% of body width: elongation cancelled. >40%: net widening.

thresholds.name: Shallow V null threshold
thresholds.description: Above 80 degree total V angle, approaches crew/scoop and ML drops to near zero

thresholds.name: Golden ratio target (default/Western)
thresholds.description: Optimal upper-to-lower body proportion (fraction from top for waist break)

thresholds.name: Golden ratio target (tall body adjustment)
thresholds.description: Tall women need break ABOVE GR to maintain long leg lines

thresholds.name: Golden ratio aesthetic effect size
thresholds.description: GR rated 6.71 vs equal division 6.45 on 10-pt scale = 2.6% of range. Barely perceptible.

thresholds.name: Attention-to-size conversion factor
thresholds.unit: percent size change per percent fixation shift

thresholds.name: Focal point strength threshold
thresholds.description: Focal point must exceed 0.3 strength to override baseline gaze

thresholds.name: Loose clothing gaze shift threshold
thresholds.unit: cm garment ease beyond body circumference
thresholds.description: Binary threshold where garment breaks free from body contour at waist-hip

thresholds.name: Vertical element count threshold for Oppel-Kundt reversal
thresholds.description: Below 4: HVI elongation (slimming). Above 8-12: Oppel-Kundt widening dominates.

thresholds.name: Frame effect HVI reduction
thresholds.description: Vertical lines within horizontal frame (standard garment) reduce HVI from 5-10% to ~1%

thresholds.name: Loose fit body-size crossover
thresholds.description: Above UK12-14: loose slims (-5-8%). Below UK6-8: loose widens (+2-4%). Between: neutral.

thresholds.name: Structured vs soft fabric fit modifiers
thresholds.description: Structured loose (blazer) creates engineered shape. Soft loose (jersey) partially reveals body.

thresholds.name: Asymmetric score anchors
thresholds.description: Score = pct/10.7 for slimming; pct/15.37 for widening. Asymmetric because reversal effects produce larger widening than any combination produces slimming.

thresholds.name: V-neck dividing threshold by bust size (bust_differential -> max_depth)
thresholds.description: Maximum V-depth before elongation collapses into bust dividing effect. Threshold lowers with larger bust.

thresholds.name: V-neck effective depth stretch adjustment
thresholds.description: Stretch fabric increases effective V-depth. On DD bust with 10% stretch: +0.28". On G cup with 15% stretch: +0.60".

thresholds.name: V-neck elongation plateau depth
thresholds.description: Peak elongation occurs at 4" depth. Returns plateau at 5-6". At 7"+ begins declining on DD+ bust.

thresholds.name: V-neck optimal depth by body type
Crew neck shortening vs bare neck
Loose crew neck elongation inversion threshold
thresholds.unit: inches of effective drop below collarbone
thresholds.description: Above 1.0" effective drop, crew neck functions as scoop and ELONGATES rather than shortens.

thresholds.name: Boat neck shoulder widening by coverage ratio
Boat neck narrow shoulders + short neck conflict thresholds
thresholds.decision_formula: If neck_deficit > shoulder_deficit * 0.5: AVOID (neck penalty dominates)

thresholds.name: Square neck face angularization by face shape
Square neck corner retention by fabric drape
thresholds.description: Below 30% corner retention, square neck functions as scoop. Angularization drops to near zero.

thresholds.name: Wrap dress small bust bunching threshold
Wrap dress very slim frame bunching threshold
Sweetheart bust enhancement by cup size
Cowl neck volume addition by fabric weight
Off-shoulder skin-to-fabric width perception ratio
thresholds.description: Bare skin reads approximately 10-15% wider than same surface covered in fitted fabric

thresholds.name: Sleeve termination anatomical zones and scores
3/4 sleeve translation problem arm length thresholds
thresholds.tall_fix: Recommend '7/8 sleeve' garments for actual 3/4 position

fitted_0_to_1.5.effect: NEUTRAL - skimming fit shows arm at true width

thresholds.name: Puff sleeve scale penalty per inch below 5'4"
Puff sleeve shoulder width extension per side
thresholds.unit: inches per side of perceived shoulder extension

thresholds.name: Flutter vs cap sleeve qualitative bonus
thresholds.description: Flutter provides 0.60 score point swing on -1 to +1 scale vs rigid cap at same position

thigh_danger_zone.description: Widest thigh point - primarily affects pear body type

thresholds.name: Below-knee safe zone collapse thresholds
thresholds.muscular_calf_exception: 5'6" with calf_prominence 1.45: calf_radius=2.25", safe_zone=1.25" - MARGINAL despite average height

thresholds.name: Above-knee elongation per inch
thresholds.unit: inches perceived leg extension per inch above knee
thresholds.diminishing_returns: Max score +0.60 from above-knee position alone

thresholds.name: Golden ratio target for leg proportion
thresholds.description: Legs should ideally be 61.8% of total visual height (Western default)
thresholds.confidence: MEDIUM for Western, LOW for global

thresholds.name: Waist placement scoring by leg proportion
Belt waist definition failure on apple
A-line flare origin relative to hip thresholds
Fit-and-flare WHR reduction by body type
Rectangle fit-skim failure threshold
thresholds.description: When bust-waist-hip differential < 4", 'fit at narrowest, skim over widest' reads as inconsistent fit

thresholds.name: Fitted vs loose scoring by contour smoothness
Hourglass shape loss threshold from dark monochrome
thresholds.description: All-dark on WHR < 0.75 erases waist-hip differential

thresholds.name: Perceived shoulder width inch-to-score mapping
thresholds.note: Sign inverts when goal is NARROWING vs WIDENING

thresholds.name: Perceived arm width inch-to-score mapping
thresholds.calibration_anchor: 3/4 sleeve on 12" arm = -0.95" narrowing = score ~+1.0. Cap sleeve at widest = +0.49 to +0.99" widening = score -0.5 to -1.0.

interactions.name: Turtleneck + cap sleeve
interactions.effect: Independent dimensions but emergent 'block' gestalt penalty -0.15 to -0.25

interactions.name: High-waist + crop top
interactions.effect: Max waist definition +0.70 to +0.90 if WHR < 0.80; collapses to -0.20 to -0.40 if visible rolls

thresholds.name: Goal-based weight adjustments
thresholds.normalization: Divide all weights by sum to ensure they total 1.0

thresholds.name: Arm circumference profile decay function
thresholds.formula: C(p) = C_max * exp(-((p - P_max)^2) / (2 * sigma^2)) + C_baseline

clean_hem.mechanism: hard boundary creates precise width marker

elastic.mechanism: gathered edge disrupts frame but still creates boundary

raw_edge.mechanism: unfinished edge slightly softer than clean hem

thresholds.name: Confidence level definitions

HIGH.sources: Multiple practitioner consensus + perceptual science + computational validation

MEDIUM.sources: Strong practitioner consensus + logical inference, limited formal studies

LOW.sources: Practitioner claims with limited validation, highly individual-dependent

high_examples: Cap sleeve widening at widest point
low_examples: Tent effect on specific bust projections

thresholds.name: Proportion optimization vs practical scoring
thresholds.description: Two scoring modes for different contexts
thresholds.practical_scoring: Factors in context, comfort, user preferences
thresholds.example: V-neck may score +0.60 proportion but -0.20 practical for 'professional context + minimal bust attention'

thresholds.name: Monochrome vs color blocking scoring thresholds
Pattern scale thresholds (LOW confidence)
thresholds.note: LEAST researched area. No rigorous study has resolved pattern scale x body size.

thresholds.name: Hourglass bust projection effective depth addition
V-neck bust framing depth ratio zones

zones.effect: Well past threshold - deep V entirely bust feature

name: Cling Threshold Base Formula
note: 62 and 26 are reverse-engineered from endpoints. Cling onset likely sigmoidal, not linear.

name: Apple Belly Ease Consumption
note: 0.8 consumption fraction is a calibrated estimate

name: Wrap Dress Gapping Threshold
trigger: belly_projection > gap_threshold -> wrap physically opens at belly

thresholds.gt_15in: AVOID - hits widest arm point = sausage sleeve effect

name: Pear Hemline Dead Zone
value: 3" range centered on widest hip point, approximately 7-10 inches below natural waist

name: Body Shape Classification Thresholds
pear: hip_waist_diff >= 7 AND hip_waist > bust_waist + 2 AND shoulder_hip_ratio < 1.05
apple: (bust_waist < 5 AND hip_waist < 5) OR belly_projection >= 3, AND belly_projection >= 2

name: Dark + Shiny Cancellation Threshold
formula: sheen_cancellation = sheen_score x 2.0; adjusted_score = adjusted_score x max(0, 1 - sheen_cancellation)
at_sheen_0_75_plus: dark is actively WORSE than medium-tone matte

name: Muffin-Top Risk
additional: Belly zone concern > 0.3 required for trigger

name: Mid Rise Reference
source_rationale: Rise gradient zero point (Fan et al.)

name: Warm-Skin Sallow Gradient
formula: sallow_strength = max(0.0, 1.0 - (color_lightness / 0.22)). skin_mult = 1.0 - sallow_strength. Pure black (L=0.08): skin_mult = 0.36. Dark brown (L=0.18): skin_mult = 0.82.

name: Dark Skin Low Contrast
effect: skin_mult = 0.5 for dark garment near face

name: Narrow Rigid Waistband Override
effect: OVERRIDE score to -0.25 for apple/plus with belly_zone > 0.3

name: Waist Elevation Ratio-Dependent Per-Inch Benefit
critical_note: The inversion threshold (ratio 0.85) is the biggest calibration risk — could be 0.75 or 0.90.

name: Shoe Height Diminishing Returns
formula: heel<=2: effective=heel. 2<heel<=4: effective=2.0+(heel-2.0)*0.80. heel>4: effective=3.6+(heel-4.0)*0.60. score = min(0.80, effective/2.25).

name: Waist Depression Exponential Saturation
formula: base = -0.30 * (1 - exp(-0.35 * depression)). Ratio modifier: 0.30 (short torso) to 1.80 (long torso).

name: Positive Score Cap
description: Positive aggregation total capped at 0.70 (with 2.5x normalization factor)

name: Individual Sabotage Penalty Cap
description: Each individual sabotage penalty capped at 0.40 before product-complement stacking

meaning: WHR below which Helmholtz H-stripe slimming effect is positive, above which it begins to transition toward reversal
WHR at or above which H-stripes fully reverse and actively widen (Ashida Reversal)
Stripe width ratio above which slim effect collapses to 30% and is capped at negative
Torso-leg ratio below which high rise creates torso compression override (tall benefit nullified)
Distance below which bust congestion occurs with high rise garments
V-neck depth beyond which bust exposure becomes dominant concern
Shoulder width at 25th percentile, below which narrow-shoulder logic activates
Short neck threshold - turtleneck most harmful below this length
Medium neck length - turtleneck transition zone
Long neck threshold - turtleneck becomes acceptable
Minimum skin-garment luminance contrast below which slimming effect is attenuated linearly
Fabric sheen above which slim benefit is penalized; at high sheen (>0.50), up to 80% of slim benefit lost
A-line flare angle above which shortening effect dominates on petite bodies (petite cap at 20 degrees)
WHR above which bodycon becomes net negative (maps midsection as widest feature)
Minimum luminance difference between side panel and center panel for optimal waist contraction effect
Maximum luminance difference between side panel and center panel for optimal waist contraction effect
Multiplier applied before tanh squash in composite scoring: final = tanh(raw * 3.0) to squash to [-1, +1]
Belt width above which it is PROHIBITED for petite bodies
Height below which petite body type is triggered (5'3")
Height above which tall body type is triggered (5'8")
Hip-bust circumference difference above which pear body type is triggered (H_c - B_c >= 3.6 inches)
WHR above which apple body type is triggered (AND W_c > B_c AND W_c > H_c)
Maximum bust-hip difference for hourglass classification (|B_c - H_c| <= 1 inch AND waist differential >= 9 inches)
Minimum waist differential for hourglass classification
Maximum bust-waist difference for rectangle (|B_c - W_c| < 9 inches AND |H_c - W_c| < 10 inches)
Bust-hip difference above which inverted triangle triggers (B_c - H_c > 3.6 inches AND S_w > H_c x 0.38)
Waist circumference above which plus size modifier activates (W_c > 37 inches OR WHR > 0.85 at larger scale)
WHR below which full Helmholtz slimming applies (slim = +0.06, tall = +0.03)
Maximum stripe width as fraction of torso width for petite H-stripe benefit
Luminance floor for petite - below L* 15 dark recession is too severe. Suggest navy/charcoal (L* 18-25).
Minimum mid-rise height as safe default for apple body type
Maximum mid-rise height as safe default for apple body type
Fabric stretch above which stripes on fitted silhouette curve over convexities, revealing body shape
Fabric drape below which rigid fabric penalty kicks in for luminance scoring
Sheen above 0.7 on dark fabric: specular highlights map 3D body contours, REVERSING dark-color slimming. EX-01.
Fit tightness > 0.8 on dark fabric: tight dark clothing reveals body contour instead of concealing. EX-02.
Rigidity > 0.7 on light fabric: structured garment holds silhouette, reduces widening from +6% to +1.8%. EX-03.
Red with saturation < 0.4 acts as advancing pink (widening), not slimming red. EX-07.
Fewer than 3 visible horizontal stripes: insufficient repetition for Helmholtz. Single stripe = emphasis band. EX-09.
Contrast ratio below 1.5: insufficient for Helmholtz effect. EX-14.
Stripe width > 2 inches weakens Helmholtz effect. EX-10.
BMI above which Helmholtz slimming begins linear decay toward zero
BMI above which Helmholtz REVERSES: stripes ADD +2% widening on larger bodies
Bust > 40 inches + V-neck depth > 6 inches: fabric pulls apart, ΔSHR flips from -0.03 to +0.02. EX-15.
V-neck depth > 6 inches combined with bust > 40 inches triggers gaping. EX-15.
Neck < 3 inches: boat neckline creates 'head directly on shoulders' compression. Aesthetic penalty -0.10. EX-17.
Scoop width > 10 inches: effect flips from narrowing (-0.02) to widening (+0.02), behaves like boat neck. EX-19.
Bust > 39 inches + turtleneck: creates monolithic upper block. EX-20.
Upper arm > 13 inches: off-shoulder creates aesthetic penalty. EX-22.
WHR > 0.88 + contrast belt: belt spotlights ABSENCE of waist indentation. ΔWHR reverses from -0.02 to +0.02. EX-37.
WHR > 0.90 + bust > 38 inches + standard wrap: tie gathers fabric at widest zone. ΔWHR reduced to -0.01. EX-38.
Bust > 42 inches + standard wrap: V-neck gapes under bust weight, tension lines. EX-39.
SHR < 0.85 + peplum flare > 3 inches: mushroom effect. ΔWHR reverses to +0.02. EX-25.
Fit > 0.85: princess seam puckers, nullifying waist definition. EX-41.
Bust < 33 inches + empire waist: childlike proportion. EX-42.
VR < 0.40 + high-waist: torso compressed to tiny strip. ΔVR REVERSES from -0.06 to +0.03 (HARMFUL). EX-45.
Perceived VR < 0.30: catastrophic overcorrection (head-on-hips appearance). Engine blocks.
Perceived VR < 0.35: warning for overcorrection risk.
Skin-shoe color value difference > 0.15: creates visible color break at ankle, WORSENING leg-line continuity. ΔVR reverses from -0.02 to +0.01. EX-47.
Height < 63 inches + ankle strap: horizontal line visually amputates leg. Strong avoid. EX-48.
Target SHR approximately 1.0 (balanced). SHR < 0.88 = pear. SHR > 1.05 = inverted triangle.
WHR target range lower bound (0.67-0.80 for US/urban markets). Singh 1993 with cultural caveats.
WHR target range upper bound. WHR > 0.88 = apple/undefined waist.
Average Vertical Ratio (leg length / total height).
Optimal VR: 5% above average per Sorokowski & Pawlowski 2008 (27-nation replication).
SHR < 0.88 = pear body type.
SHR > 1.05 = inverted triangle body type.
BMI > 28 = plus size body type.
Rigidity < 0.2: fabric cannot hold structured silhouette. All construction-based effects collapse.
Multiple waist-definition techniques: 1st=100%, 2nd=80%, 3rd=50%, 4th=20%. ESTIMATED.
Fabric cling > 0.7 + WHR > 0.85: clingy fabric maps body contour at midsection. EX-62.
Rigidity > 0.7 on A-line for pear (SHR < 0.88): stiff A-line tents from widest point. ΔSHR flips from -0.04 to +0.01. EX-30.
Exposure > 30 sq inches on deep V nullifies line effect. EX-16.
BWR above which Helmholtz REVERSES: stripes ADD width instead of reducing it. Ashida 2013.
confidence: 3 stars for direction, 1 star for exact threshold

meaning: BWR below which full Helmholtz slimming applies
Stripe width above 15mm: effect attenuated to x0.40. Above 30mm: x0.15.
Duty cycle below 0.25 (thin stripes): effect enhanced x1.25.
Cling > 0.70 AND GSM < 100: stripe effect attenuated to x0.35 (body reveals, not reshapes).
All stripe scores attenuated by x0.65 for real-world context (35% reduction from lab conditions).
source: INVENTED. Bridging Thompson lab and Swami social-context.

meaning: Sheen > 0.50 on dark fabric: slimming score *= (1.0 - sheen). At 0.80: essentially neutralized.
Skin-garment contrast < 15 L* AND luminance < 0.20: slimming score *= 0.30.
Neck length ratio > 1.15: V-neck REVERSAL ('giraffe effect'). Score -0.08. Better: crew/boat/mock.
Bust diff > 18cm + deep V: exposure dominates elongation. Better: moderate V 10-12cm or scoop.
S:H < 0.90: V-neck narrows shoulders further (bad). Boat neck REVERSAL to +0.30 (widens where needed).
TLR < 0.92 + petite: deep V empties torso, reveals shortness. Better: moderate V 8-10cm or sweetheart.
32-42% of inseam = WORST zone for hemline (upper calf, max circumference, V-H compounds). Score -0.25.
Upper bound of worst hemline zone.
Height < 155cm: mid-calf penalty amplified x1.50.
Height 155-163cm: mid-calf penalty amplified x1.35.
Height 163-170cm: mid-calf penalty amplified x1.15. >=170cm: x1.0 (no amplification).
US/EU market: +5% LBR preference (Sorokowski 27-nation). Confidence MEDIUM.
India market: +3% LBR preference (conservative, ZERO Indian data). A/B test in first 6 months.
TLR < 0.92: short torso. High waist makes torso disappear. Empire -0.18. Natural waist +0.10.
Rigid waistband > 0.70 + soft midsection > 0.60 = muffin-top risk (-0.15).
Soft midsection > 0.60 combined with rigid waistband triggers muffin-top penalty.
Empire creating +12% LBR shift = maternity silhouette on non-pregnant users.
Heavy fabric > 250 GSM adds 3-7% visual width.
Light fabric < 80 GSM clings and reveals body contour.
Bust-waist diff > 16cm + light fabric: cling reveals every contour. Score -0.20.
Light starch: starch_factor = 0.3. effective_gsm = gsm x (1 + starch_factor).
Heavy starch: starch_factor = 0.7. A 120 GSM cotton saree with heavy starch behaves like 200+ GSM structured fabric.
Pattern > 5cm on petite: -0.15 penalty.
Pattern < 3cm on plus: -0.10 (visual noise).
Border-to-width ratio > 0.15 = significant widening penalty for saree.
Each 2mm fabric layer adds ~0.4cm per side visual width.
Menopause step function begins at age 50. Collagen loss step over 50-55.
Menopause step function ends at age 55. ~30% collagen lost in 5 years.
Tissue compliance < 0.70 AND sleeveless AND GSM < 130: suggest heavier fabric for cleaner armhole line. NEVER suggest longer sleeves.
Helmholtz 3D stereoscopic 10.7% width change = score +/- 1.0. All other effects proportional to this empirical ceiling.
fit_weight (>=0.35) >= sum(all_optical_illusion_weights). Well-fitted wrong color always outscores ill-fitted right color.
